intro: Astroloma divaricatum, commonly known as the variable astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Astroloma divaricatum is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
